name: The 'Glaswegian' Antics
description:
This game was the second coursework for the Game Content Design course in the 2nd year of university; For this piece of coursework, we had to demonstrate our ability to design levels suitable for a single-player game. 

The idea was for our team (me and another designer) to apply our level design capabilities to portray a story of a character named Derek that was kidnapped and roughed up by some Glafia hoodlums who believe he stole their money. hey bundle him into a van and take him to a warehouse in the East End of Glasgow where they beat him and threaten him if he doesn’t return the cash. The game starts after these hoodlums lock Derek back in the van and are driving away but there is an explosion.  When Derek wakes, the player is in control and the level begins. 

We had to make some sort of a puzzle to incorporate into the gameplay as well as base our level around the idea of enemies bots that would attack you (the Glafia - the Glasgow Mafia).
